title: What's going on with Rafael Devers? Putting his historic strikeout streak into context
content: Devers has struck out 15 times and has no hits through five games. Here's what history tells us about his bad start.

title: Williams leaves Aggies for Maryland hoops job
content: Buzz Williams has been hired as the new men's basketball coach at Maryland, ending his six-year stint at Texas A&M.

title: Niners owner: Exodus partly tied to paying Purdy
content: San Francisco 49ers owner Jed York said the team's decision to move on from several veterans was the flip side of needing to sign quarterback Brock Purdy to a massive new deal.

title: Tush push ban vote tabled; 16 NFL teams in favor
content: NFL owners have tabled voting on the Green Bay Packers' proposal to ban the tush push in order to have further discussion.

title: Jones: Cowboys, Parsons agree on 'most' issues
content: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones says he's met with star pass rusher Micah Parsons for "five or six hours" over the last two weeks, and believes the two sides agree on "most" issues as talks over a new deal continue.

title: Rooney: 'Positive' signs on Rodgers to Steelers
content: Steelers owner and president Art Rooney II said he keeps "hearing" that Aaron Rodgers is "headed in our direction."

title: NBA suspends 5 players for Pistons-Wolves scuffle
content: Detroit's Isaiah Stewart, Marcus Sasser and Ron Holland II and Minnesota's Donte DiVincenzo and Naz Reid were all suspended for their roles in Sunday's skirmish.

title: Messi's bodyguard banned from MLS sidelines
content: Lionel Messi's bodyguard Yassine Cheuko has been banned from protecting the Argentine forward from the touchline during Inter Miami matches.

title: NFL owners OK kickoff, replay, OT rule changes
content: NFL owners approved a variety of rule changes Tuesday, including a modification of the dynamic kickoff that will place the ball after touchbacks at the 35-yard line and a tweak to the regular-season overtime period to mirror postseason rules.

title: Inside the Grizzlies' shocking firing of Taylor Jenkins
content: The Grizzlies believe this firing will help reconnect the team's tantalizing core -- and reignite Ja Morant. But in truth, this dismissal began with five other ones nearly a year ago.

title: NHL playoff watch: Will the Capitals or Jets win the Presidents' Trophy?
content: It appears to be a two-team race for the No. 1 overall seed. Plus, updated playoff bracket projections.

title: NBA play-in tournament 2025: Schedule, standings, format
content: Everything you need to know about the play-in tournament, including how it works, who's playing and when.

title: Pain Index: Where do Arkansas, Purdue, other second-weekend losses rank?
content: Some losses are understandable; others will haunt us forever. Let's rank the 2025 men's NCAA tournament defeats, from least to most devastating.

title: 'The whole thing is chaos': The art of the March Madness buzzer-beater
content: How does a buzzer-beater come to be? A little strategy, a lot of luck, and the right player at the right time.

title: Women's Final Four predictions: A unanimous favorite and a split decision
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas are bound for Tampa, as well as 2-seed UConn. Who will reach the title game?

title: Reranking the women's Final Four: First look at the national semifinals
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas advanced to the Final Four. But 2-seed UConn tops our list.

title: An MIT-educated professor, the New York Yankees and the bat that could be changing baseball
content: After the Yankees' home run barrage with bats that look like bowling pins, the innovation is sweeping baseball.

title: Guardiola: Haaland (ankle) out for up to 7 weeks
content: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola confirmed that Erling Haaland could be on the sidelines for seven weeks with an ankle injury he picked up against Bournemouth in their FA Cup quarterfinal.

title: Flick: No luck to Barcelona success this season
content: Hansi Flick has said there is no luck to Barcelona success this season but he knows it's trophies that matter as he prepares for Wednesday's "final before the final" against Atlético Madrid in the Copa del Rey.

title: Liverpool not affected by Trent speculation - Slot
content: Arne Slot has said he is not affected by speculation over Trent Alexander-Arnold's future amid reports the defender could move to Real Madrid.

title: Fernandes 'going nowhere this summer' - Amorim
content: Bruno Fernandes will not be allowed to leave Manchester United this summer, according to head coach Ruben Amorim.

title: Rooney considered leaving Man Utd for Barcelona
content: Wayne Rooney has revealed he came close to joining Barcelona in 2010 in a transfer that would have seen him link up with Lionel Messi, Xavi and Andres Iniesta at Camp Nou.

title: Women's team sale pads £128.4m Chelsea profit
content: Chelsea recorded a pre-tax profit before taxation of 128.4 million pounds ($165.83 million) for the year ending in June despite a fall in revenue thanks to the repositioning of their women's team, the Premier League club said on Monday.

title: Las Palmas GK undergoes perforated bowel op
content: Las Palmas goalkeeper Jasper Cillessen underwent successful surgery to repair a bowel perforation, the LaLiga club announced on Monday.

title: Wrexham revenue up 155% amid promotion push
content: Wrexham reported record financial results for their first year back in the EFL in the latest chapter of the club's success story.

title: Vermes' Sporting KC exit marks end of a managerial era in MLS
content: Peter Vermes left Sporting KC, and as he goes, so too does the idea of a singular leader of a modern MLS club.

title: 2025 rankings: Profiles for more than 40 RBs
content: Mike Clay provides detailed breakdowns of the top running backs for the 2025 fantasy football season.

title: Like father, like son: Boozer twins, Anthony lead wave of legacy talent in major hoops week
content: From former NCAA champions to NBA All-Stars, here's a look at players competing that boast a familiar surname.

title: After Olympics controversy, Jordan Chiles is 'That Girl' leading UCLA to NCAAs
content: Chiles always knew she could help the Bruins win an NCAA title, but she didn't know how much they would help her heal.

title: Men's Final Four predictions, previews for Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston
content: Here's how each 1-seed reached San Antonio and their key to reaching the final, plus disagreement on one game.

title: Messi, Brady, Shaq turn out for Beckham's 50th birthday party in Miami
content: He doesn't turn 50 for another month, but David Beckham has already kicked off the celebrations for his half-century by throwing a party in Miami.

title: Letting Salah leave for free could be one of Liverpool's biggest mistakes ever
content: Every time Mohamed Salah scores, he gets closer to Erling Haaland's record, and Liverpool's failure to hand him a new contract looks even more reckless.

title: Adrian Peterson, Antonio Gates take center stage in Madden NFL 25 Season 7
content: Another wave of Madden Ultimate Team content has been revealed, with Franchise Heroes coming to the roster.

title: Possible terror attack thwarted with one arrest, hand grenade seized: Punjab Police
content: Meanwhile, the CI team of Ferozepur busted a cross-border drug smuggling racket with the arrest of a smuggler and seized 3.50 kilogram of heroin from his possession, officials said.

title: India, China should realise cooperative ‘pas de deux’ of dragon and elephant, says Xi Jinping on 75th anniversary of bilateral ties
content: Mr. Xi termed India and China “ancient civilisations, major developing countries and important members of the Global South”, and noted that both countries are at a critical stage in their respective modernisation drive.

title: Centre has no intention of using new Bill to meddle with cooperatives: Minister in Rajya Sabha
content: The Minister said the Tribhuvan Sahkari University Bill is part of several new initiatives by the Ministry

title: Maharashtra Cabinet approves e-bike taxis, mineral foundation in Gadchiroli district
content: State Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik said the e-bike policy was the ‘first step’ towards a pollution-free Maharashtra, and could generate 10,000 jobs in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region and 20,000 jobs across Maharashtra

title: Allies support Waqf Bill, JD(U) urges government to not implement with retrospective effect
content: TDP, while backing the Bill, is silent on the finer details of its position; LJP (Ram Vilas) with just five MPs attacked the Opposition for running a ‘misleading narrative’

title: GST gross collections for 2024-2025 touch ₹44,825 crore
content: The net GST collections in March 2025 reached ₹3,116 crore, marking the highest amount collected in the past 11 months and the second highest in the year, said Chief Commissioner of Tax Babu A.

title: Centre rejects Opposition charge that off-shore mining was affecting fishermen community
content: The Minister made the comment in the Lok Sabha while replying to a Calling Attention Motion, moved by senior Congress member K. C. Venugopal on the “hardships faced by the fishermen community”

title: Law enforcement should be aware of changes in country: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: At the D.P. Kohli Memorial Lecture, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told law enforcement agencies that they needed to collaborate more with academia, startups, and industry

title: Bombay High Court denies bail to school bus driver for sexually assaulting a minor
content: Driver allegedly stopped bus, sexually assaulted eight-year-old girl; offence is “very serious, grave and heinous,” says judge, denying bail despite accused completing a third of the maximum sentence possible

title: Opposition hail SC order on demolitions in U.P., push for strict regulations
content: Describing PDA’s actions as ‘illegal’ and ‘targeting certain people’, the opposition has stressed the importance of delivering justice.

title: Tejashwi challenges Amit Shah to ‘face-to-face talk’ with facts
content: The RJD leader was reacting to allegations levelled by the Union Home Minister during the latter’s visit to Gopalganj on Sunday (March 30, 2025); Shah had slammed RJD and party supremo Lalu Prasad over ‘jungle raj’ in Bihar

title: CPI(M) party congress in Madurai will be politically significant, says veteran journalist N. Ram
content: Draft political resolution, which notes that the Hindutva-corporate nexus displays neo-fascist characteristics, is a very important and new observation, N. Ram says

title: Delhi HC faults Centre for not following due process in OCI card holder blacklisting case
content: Govt. says the petitioner was denied entry because he had been blacklisted by security agencies on account of his involvement in missionary activities in Nagaland and other northeastern States without obtaining special permission from the competent authority

title: Crackdown on wheeling offences: 398 cases booked in March in Bengaluru
content: Officials said that 397 vehicles were seized, and 324 individuals were arrested during the drive. Among those caught, 82 were minors, prompting authorities to take action against 68 guardians for negligence.

title: Tamil Nadu working on a blueprint to protect the ‘feathered foresters’ that restore ecology
content: The State has planned to establish a Centre of Excellence to conserve the Great Hornbill, the Malabar Pied Hornbill, the Indian Grey Hornbill, and the Malabar Grey Hornbill. The Forest Department has identified key areas for conservation: Anamalai Tiger Reserve, Athikkadavu-Pilloor-Bhavanisagar Valley, and the drier forests like Sathyamangalam

title: When Turkey’s Honorary Consul-General was disqualified as MLA in Tamil Nadu
content: In the 1980 Tamil Nadu Assembly election, Congress leader K.S. Haja Shereff won from Triplicane. The next year, Governor Sadiq Ali announced that Shereff was to be disqualified because of his appointment as Turkey’s Honorary Consul-General in Madras. Shereff moved the Madras High Court, which upheld his disqualification

title: India, Chile to start talks for comprehensive trade pact: PM
content: World’s biggest copper producer CODELCO signs deal with Hindustan Copper Ltd that could reduce Chile’s dependence on Chinese market; India, Chile agree to deepen cooperation on Antarctica exploration

title: Amid protests against flyover, Hemant Soren takes part in Sarhul festival
content: Tribals continue protests with black flags and slogans directed at the Chief Minister; BJP accuses Soren of ignoring the voice of the tribal society

title: Farmers stage protest seeking release of water into NLBC to save standing crops
content: A large number of farmers participate in the protest outside the KBJNL Chief Engineer’s office in Bheemarayanagudi

title: 2,988 drugs were declared ‘substandard’ in West Bengal in 2024
content: 1,06,150 drug samples were tested in the past one year, and prosecution launched against 604 enterprises for the manufacture, sale and distribution of spurious drugs, Minister of State for Health Anupriya Patel said in the Rajya Sabha

title: Parents can choose to cancel gift deeds executed in favour of select children: Madras High Court
content: A Division Bench says even if senior citizens had settled multiple properties in favour of different children, they could choose to cancel only select deeds

title: APMC should oversee strict adherence to medical ethics, says Minister Satya Kumar
content: Swearing-in ceremony of six nominated members of the interim A.P. Medical Council held at Dr. NTR University of Health Science

title: Vizhinjam handles 240 ships, 4.9 lakh TEU cargo in first fiscal
content: The seaport sets another record by handling over 1 lakh containers in a single month by managing 1.08 lakh TEUs from 51 vessels in March

title: SCR Vijayawada division achieves its highest freight loading, revenue during FY 2024-25
content: The gross revenue of the division for FY 2024-25 was ₹5,836.61 crore, the highest-ever in the history of Vijayawada division, say SCR officials

title: Pharmacy intern suicide: She will die if shifted to another hospital, say doctors
content: The 23-year-old intern at KIMS-Bollineni hospital remains on ventilator support as doctors deem her condition too critical for transfer

title: NMC tax collections amount to ₹77.76 crore this fiscal
content: The civic body collected an additional ₹11.38 crore in financial year 2024-25 when compared to total ₹66.38 crore in last fiscal

title: Police probe murder conspiracy against MLC R. Rajendra after leaked audio surfaces
content: Rajendra lodged a formal complaint with the Tumakuru Superintendent of Police after receiving a pen drive containing the audio file

title: KMC achieves 75 per cent property tax collection
content: Officials realise an amount of ₹71.79 crore, which includes ₹12.53 crore arrears and the 2024-25 financial year’s demand of ₹59.26 crore

title: Assam launches entrepreneurship support scheme for women
content: The initiative targets 30 lakh women, a major voting force in a State where elections are a year away

title: NEP-2020 opens new career paths, reduces unemployment: T.V. Kattimani
content: NEP-2020 boosts career options with multi-disciplinary learning, says Central Tribal University VC T.V. Kattimani, urging nationwide adoption

title: Two arrested for ‘murder’ of YSRCP activist; Jagan assures support to family
content: The killing that happened at Papireddypalle in Ramagiri mandal has raised a political furore, with the YSRCP alleging it as a politically motivated one

title: Councillor urges Tirunelveli Corporation to save its land worth ₹16 crore from encroachers
content: B. Seetha, councillor of Ward No. 39 in Tirunelveli to safeguard 80 cents of prime land which had been retrieved from encroachers who have taken the matter to the court

title: Thrikkakara municipality’s bid for waste dumping-free status hits roadblock
content: Residents allege municipal waste has not been handled properly, while municipality officials say new treatment plants and stricter measures will ensure sanitation

title: Modernised Tirupati railway station to be opened in few months
content: With 20 lifts and 22 escalators coming up, Tirupati will become one of the major railway destinations in the country to offer such modern amenities to the passengers, says Tirupati railway station Director

title: EC holds meetings with political parties at the grassroots level
content: Commission concludes massive engagement drive aimed at resolving poll issues, including complaints about duplicate voter IDs and electoral roll manipulation

title: Kerala University to hold re-examination for MBA students after loss of answer sheets
content: V-C acknowledges systemic lapses in examination system; assures permanent solution.  Teacher responsible for the loss of answer sheets will be debarred from examination duties

title: Kanniyakumari district records sharp decline in deaths in road accidents
content: 106 people died between January and March 2024 while the figure is 49 for the corresponding period this year; Kanniyakumari SP attributes it to strict enforcement of rules

title: Hosabale says Kashi, Mathura efforts are fine, but how far back to dig history
content: Two countervailing forces are at work in the Sangh universe — that of drawing a line under the temple movements, and that of including two other disputes in the same pantheon as Ayodhya

title: Manipur BJP MLAs seek review of 2001 census, NRC implementation before delimitation
content: BJP MLAs in Manipur demand review of 2001 Census and NRC before delimitation exercise, amid ethnic violence concerns

title: Low vacation season booking worries tourism stakeholders in Kerala
content: Kerala tourism faces challenges with low advance bookings, drop in tourist arrivals, and tough competition from Kodagu.

title: 'I am not joking': What's behind Trump's 'president-for-life' push?
content: US President Donald Trump has hinted at serving a third term, despite the 22nd Amendment prohibiting it. Legal scholars and democracy advocates are concerned, as this echoes tactics used by authoritarian leaders. Trump's fascination with strongmen and frequent provocations suggest a serious intent, challenging democratic norms and drawing significant attention.

title: Why BJP pitch for Waqf reforms may find support among a section of Muslims
content: The Waqf Amendment Bill is poised to get Parliament's approval with BJP garnering support from key allies, despite opposition from the INDIA bloc. The bill aims to aid impoverished Muslims by ensuring transparency and representation in the Waqf Board, reminiscent of the Triple Talaq Bill's impact.

title: Government lists exporters' feedback: US 2nd biggest source of curbs
content: New trade restrictions from the US and EU, involving safety standards, labeling, and environmental regulations, are impacting Indian exporters. Complaints include issues with toy and textile regulations, diamond origin certificates, recognition of BIS for gold and silver bars, and banning grape exports despite compliance. Indian officials are addressing these concerns in talks with international counterparts.

title: Cops force banker to cut short vacation to join Kamra probe
content: A 46-year-old banker from Navi Mumbai was forced to return from his holiday early due to calls from the police regarding his witness statement in a defamation case against comedian Kunal Kamra. The case involves Kamra's video that allegedly defamed Maharashtra's deputy CM, leading to an FIR.

title: ChatGPT hits 'one million users in one hour' as Ghibli photo feature goes ‘free’
content: OpenAI's ChatGPT gained one million users within an hour of launching a free Ghibli-style image generator. The feature, allowing users to create anime-inspired artwork, was initially for paid users and now includes limits for free-tier users due to high demand.

title: US court rejects Pannun’s claims on serving legal papers to Ajit Doval
content: The US court dismissed Khalistani separatist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun's claim that court documents were properly served to National Security Advisor Ajit Doval during a February visit. Judge Katherine Polk Failla cited the failure to meet specific service delivery requirements mandated by a previous court order.

title: IPL 2025: Prabhsimran's marauding knock helps PBKS sink LSG
content: Prabhsimran Singh's explosive 69 off 34 balls led Punjab Kings to an eight-wicket victory against Lucknow Super Giants in their IPL 2025 clash. Chasing 172, Punjab's aggressive approach was bolstered by Arshdeep Singh's 3/43. Despite Nicholas Pooran's 44, LSG managed only 171/7. Captain Shreyas Iyer and Nehal Wadhera ensured the win in just 16.2 overs.

title: 'Nobody told me if ... ': Trump explains correct way to say 'Qatar'
content: Donald Trump admitted to mispronouncing Qatar as 'Cut-R' and reflected on his history of linguistic gaffes involving foreign countries. His comments came ahead of outlining his controversial trade policies, which include imposing reciprocal tariffs to address what he views as unfair international trade practices.

title: Minecraft April Fools' 2025 update: Mojang Studio introduces mob animator feature
content: To celebrate April Fools' Day 2025, Minecraft introduced a 'mob animator' feature allowing players to combine different mobs for unique results. Available for 24 hours on Minecraft's website, this limited-time Easter egg includes items like TNT, cobblestone, and various mobs for experimental combinations and amusing effects.

title: 'Politics no part-time job': Akhilesh Yadav's 'don't do it' jab at Yogi
content: Akhilesh Yadav criticized those treating politics as a part-time job, seemingly targeting UP CM Yogi Adityanath. Adityanath defended his commitment, emphasizing his role as a Yogi and dismissed any rift with BJP's leadership. He also addressed his 'bulldozer justice' policy and the order against namaz on public roads.

title: Man kills friend's 7-year-old daughter in fit of rage over TV remote
content: A seven-year-old girl was killed by her father's friend in Swaroop Nagar, Delhi, over a dispute involving a TV remote. The accused, Ranjeet Singh, allegedly struck the child multiple times, causing fatal injuries. He was arrested after police tracked his location to Narela. The girl's body was sent for a post-mortem examination.

title: 'Rs 27 crore ka pahalwaan': Pant's struggles trigger meme fest
content: Rishabh Pant is facing a challenging start with Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2025, struggling to deliver with the bat despite being the most expensive player bought for Rs 27 crore. His low scores from the first three matches have prompted criticism and social media trolling. In three matches, he has managed just 15 runs at a dismal average of 7.50.

title: NSA’s ‘new’ warning to iPhone and Android users: ‘Change this setting on your phones’
content: The NSA has highlighted the risks of user behavior in secure messaging, focusing on Signal's Linked Devices and Group Invite Links features. These can lead to unauthorized access and unintended exposure of sensitive conversations. NSA advises users to review linked devices and disable group links to safeguard privacy. The Trump administration has declared the Signal incident 'case closed.'

title: $1.4tn trade war: How Trump tariffs could hit the world, may lift India slightly
content: President Trump plans to announce 'Liberation Day,' imposing 25% tariffs intended to boost US revenue by $6 trillion over a decade but risking global economic instability. Economists predict a $1.4 trillion global income hit, inflation, and disrupted trade. While some countries like India may gain initially, experts warn of long-term negative impacts.

title: All you need to know about Tom Holland's Spider-man: Brand New Day
content: Marvel announced the new Spider-Man movie titled 'Spider-Man: Brand New Day,' with Destin Daniel Cretton set to direct. Filming begins this summer, and the movie is scheduled for release on July 31, 2026. Tom Holland will return, and the cast includes Zendaya, Jacob Batalon, and new addition Sadie Sink.

title: 17 violators fined ₹10,000 each for drunk driving in Chittoor
content: 868 persons were caught since the beginning of 2025 for driving under the influence of alcohol and a fine of ₹86.8 lakh imposed on them by the court, according to the police

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu promises support to shipbuilding industry in Parchur constituency
content: It is expected to generate employment and drive economic growth in the region, he says; he sanctions a double road from the national highway to Valaparla Industrial Park and a water storage tank at Valaparla

title: Midnight market by women entrepreneurs in Kochi on April 5, 6
content: The event will showcase Kochi as a vibrant hub of fun and entertainment while highlighting its commitment to safety, especially for women and children, say the organisers

title: Srisailam temple receives ₹6.09 crore as hundi offerings
content: Apart from the cash, more than 200 gm of gold and 6.200 kg silver were received when the counting was done amid heavy security and under CCTV surveillance

title: Not even an inch of Kancha Gachibowli land belongs to UoH, asserts govt.
content: Ministers release revenue records and criticise the BRS and BJP for spreading false propaganda on the land

title: INTUC declares support for ASHAs, urges talks to settle stir
content: A meeting will be called in the next two or three days, says Health Minister. After meeting Union  Health Minister on Tuesday, she says  she had a detailed discussion with him and that the tone and tenor of the talk were positive

title: India’s defence exports hit new record of ₹23,622 crore for 2024-25: Ministry of Defence
content: ‘India has evolved from a largely import-dependent military force to one increasingly focused on self-reliance and indigenous production,’ the MoD said

title: Virat Kohli's 'notebook celebration' makes a comeback in IPL - WATCH
content: Leg-spinner Digvesh Rathi brought back the iconic ‘notebook celebration’ in IPL 2025 after dismissing Punjab opener Priyansh Arya. His mimicry of Virat Kohli’s famous gesture was a highlight during Lucknow Super Giants’ match, which Punjab Kings won by chasing down 171 runs in 16.2 overs. Punjab Kings will now face Rajasthan Royals at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur, Chandigarh, on Saturday.

title: Tax Americana: Trump terrifies world, and US, with global tariffs
content: The Trump administration criticized India's agricultural protections ahead of new tariffs on imports, alleging unfair practices with high tariffs on US products. President Trump plans to announce reciprocal tariffs that will be lower than existing ones. Experts warn of potential economic repercussions from the new trade measures.

title: 'Commerce ministry working on different scenarios' to assess Trump tariff fallout'
content: The commerce ministry is preparing for various scenarios as US tariffs on Indian exports loom, potentially impacting key sectors like chemicals, textiles, and electronics. The ministry is assessing the economic effects and exploring strategies to mitigate these impacts, while also addressing non-tariff barriers imposed by the US.

title: Waqf Amendment Bill: How numbers in Parliament stack up ahead of tabling
content: The Lok Sabha is set to debate the controversial Waqf Amendment Bill, with the BJP-led NDA pushing for its passage amid strong opposition objections. Key NDA allies, initially against the Bill, now support it after their recommendations were incorporated, despite opposition walkouts and criticism.

title: IPL: Shreyas Iyer hands debut cap to 157.3 kmph star vs LSG
content: Punjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer chose to field after winning the toss against Lucknow Super Giants in Lucknow. Fast bowler Lockie Ferguson made his debut for Punjab Kings. Rishabh Pant retained the same XI from their previous match. Lucknow holds a 3-1 head-to-head advantage over Punjab. When these teams met in Lucknow last season, which was also LSG’s first home game, the hosts secured a 21-run victory.

title: SC on NGO's opposition to development projects: 'How will country progress?'
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed an NGO's plea against a renewable energy project at Jayakwadi Dam, highlighting the necessity for progress despite resistance. The court noted the NGO's actions might be influenced by a rival company's interests and found no legal restrictions in the eco-sensitive zone.

title: Trump policies spooking Indian H-1B visa, US green card holders - here’s why
content: The Trump administration's policies are causing concerns among F-1 student visa holders, H-1B visa holders, and green card holders. Many are hesitant to travel outside the US due to potential re-entry issues.

title: Big Centre vs INDIA bloc showdown over Waqf Bill tomorrow - Top points
content: The BJP government plans to present the Waqf (Amendment) Bill in the Lok Sabha, which the INDIA bloc and other opposition parties unanimously oppose. The bill is criticized for violating constitutional provisions and targeting specific communities. Delhi Police has increased security measures to maintain order.

title: IPL 2025 crorepatis who have been a royal disappointment
content: Several high-profile players, including Rishabh Pant and Rohit Sharma, are underperforming in the IPL 2025 season. Despite their hefty price tags and previous successes, they have struggled to make significant contributions in their respective matches, raising concerns for their franchises. ​This season's IPL is no exception, with a few big names making it to that unwanted list.

title: Aishwarya, Abhishek Bachchan dance on 'Kajra Re' with daughter Aaradhya
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, and their daughter Aaradhya attended Aishwarya's cousin's wedding in Pune, quelling any rumors of discord. A video of the family dancing to 'Kajra Re' captivated fans online, with Aishwarya's absence from the screen being notably felt. Aishwarya was last seen in 'Ponniyin Selvan 2' and Abhishek recently appeared in 'Be Happy'.

title: Fadnavis' 'let's see' challenge for Uddhav on Waqf Bill: 'Balasaheb or Rahul?'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis questioned Uddhav Thackeray's stance on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, to be introduced in Lok Sabha. The bill faces opposition from Congress-led INDIA bloc and Muslim organizations, with Shiv Sena (UBT) having left the BJP alliance in 2019.

title: Is your Ghibli portrait destroying the planet?
content: The demand was so overwhelming that OpenAI was forced to cap image generations at three per day per user, citing infrastructure stress. Altman followed up days later with an exhausted plea: “Can y’all please chill on generating images, this is insane. Our team needs sleep.”But why would a simple animated selfie bring one of the world’s most advanced AI systems to its knees?

title: Will Pete Alonso play tonight against Miami Marlins?
content: New York Mets fans eagerly await the return of star first baseman Pete Alonso, who displayed resilience after a spring training injury. Alonso's presence in the lineup against the Miami Marlins on April 1, 2025, will be closely watched, as he remains key to the team's offensive strength and success this season.

title: Will Gavin Lux play tonight against Texas Rangers?
content: Gavin Lux is healthy and expected to play for the Cincinnati Reds against the Texas Rangers, boosting the team's lineup despite several injury challenges. His impressive performance and defensive skills are vital for the Reds, who are dealing with key player absences.

title: 'He has nothing to say except lies, jumlas': Tejashwi Yadav slams Amit Shah
content: Tejashwi Yadav accuses BJP of manipulating Bihar election timings, claiming the Election Commission acts on BJP's signals. He criticizes Amit Shah for misleading voters with falsehoods and not addressing governance issues. Yadav also questions why BJP hasn't increased the reservation limit despite frequently mentioning it.

title: Waqf Bill: TDP extends support, JD(U) against retrospective implementation
content: Chandrababu Naidu's TDP, an NDA ally, declared support for the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, addressing management issues of Waqf properties via reforms. The Bill, set to be tabled in Lok Sabha, faces opposition allegations of being unconstitutional. TDP's backing boosts BJP's effort to pass it, promising benefits for poor Muslims. A detailed eight-hour discussion is planned.

title: Overseas Indians send home record $129.4bn in 2024
content: Indians abroad transferred a record $129.4 billion in 2024. Despite inflation in source regions, remittances continued rising, bolstered by recovery in OECD job markets post-pandemic. India's leading position in global remittances remains, with projections to reach $160 billion by 2029.

title: How Pak preachers turned this whisky-loving rockstar into a terrorist
content: ​In 1990, Ghali led a new Tuareg uprising, signing a ceasefire in 1991 after initial gains. He emerged as the face of the rebellion, even representing the Tuaregs at peace talks. But after the guns fell silent and his fellow fighters faded into government jobs or civilian life, Ghali stood at a crossroads. The world was applauding Tinariwen. He had helped them rise. But what about his revolution?

title: Halle Berry reveals magical diet and routine; stopped cardio and focuses on lifting weights
content: Halle Berry has switched her focus from cardio to weight lifting to maintain a lean and healthy physique, especially during menopause. She meticulously takes 16 vitamins daily and incorporates carbs into her diet to manage her diabetes and energy levels.

title: 'Over 1L vehicles that exceeded pollution limit still ...': BJP targets Kejriwal
content: BJP minister Majinder Singh Sirsa accused AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal of corruption, attributing Delhi's poor air quality to mismanagement and fraudulent activities. A CAG report revealed mismanagement of DTC buses and widespread issuance of PUC certificates through bribery. Sirsa claims Kejriwal's administration worsened pollution and mishandled millions allocated to the odd-even scheme.

title: 'I am a Yogi, politics not a full-time job for me': UP CM on PM aspirations
content: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath addressed speculation about his prime ministerial ambitions, emphasizing his commitment to serving Uttar Pradesh and rejecting any discord with BJP's central leadership. He defended the government's bulldozer action and the ban on offering namaz on public roads, calling for discipline during public events and religious gatherings.

title: At least 18 dead as blaze engulfs firecracker godown in Gujarat
content: A massive fire at a firecracker storage godown near Deesa town in Banaskantha district claimed at least 21 lives, with several others injured, many suffering severe burns. The fire caused the building to collapse. Emergency teams are working to retrieve bodies, and the injured are being treated at Deesa government hospital.

title: ‘We couldn’t breathe’: Myanmar earthquake victims recall being 'buried alive'
content: A 7.7-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar's Sagaing region has left over 2,000 people dead, with many trapped under rubble. Survivors recount harrowing escape stories, while rescue efforts are hindered by equipment shortages, power outages, and poor coordination. Vital infrastructure has also been severely damaged, complicating rescues.

title: 'Gareebon ko bhi rehne de': Virender Sehwag mocks RCB
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru have made an impressive start to their IPL 2025 season with victories over Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings. Despite their success, former India opener Virender Sehwag humorously mocked RCB, referencing their lack of an IPL title. RCB’s next challenge will be against Gujarat Titans on Wednesday.

title: Will Juan Soto play tonight against Miami Marlins? Latest update on New York Mets star's injury
content: Juan Soto’s participation in the New York Mets match against the Miami Marlins is uncertain due to unconfirmed reports of an injury. Soto's fitness was evident during the Opening Day roster against the Houston Astros on March 27, 2025. His presence in the Mets' lineup is crucial, bolstering their chances of success this season.

title: Was Maryland father deported by Trump a gang member?
content: His legal presence in the US was based on a protection known as “withholding of removal,” which was granted by an immigration judge in 2019. That status is awarded when a judge determines that deporting someone would expose them to persecution or torture in their home country. In Abrego Garcia’s case, the judge ruled he faced credible threats of violence if returned to El Salvador — particularly from the very gangs he was accused of belonging to.

title: Exporters brace for Trump's tariffs, expect turbulence
content: As Trump imposes 25% additional tariffs, Indian exporters, particularly in engineering and leather goods sectors, face significant financial strain. Shipments worth $5 billion are on hold, with many US buyers demanding price adjustments or discounts. Industry leaders emphasize the need for market diversification amid uncertain trade relations with the US.

title: Sensex ends over 1,300 points down: Top reasons for bear attack
content: Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Tuesday. While BSE Sensex plunged below 76,000 intraday, Nifty50 went below 23,150.

title: China, India should strengthen ties in 'Dragon-Elephant tango': Xi Jinping
content: China and India celebrated the 75th anniversary of their diplomatic relations with mutual congratulatory messages from their leaders. They emphasized strengthening cooperation, strategic trust, and maintaining border peace, guided by the direction from their previous summit meeting in Kazan, Russia.

title: Read top 5 entertainment news
content: Fawad Khan makes a Bollywood comeback with Vani Kapoor, while KL Rahul shares the first details about his daughter with Athiya Shetty. Aishwarya Rai, Aaradhya, and Abhishek Bachchan enjoy dancing to 'Kajra Re.' Additionally, Kapoor reunites with Aditya Roy Kapur for a romantic movie. Stay tuned for more updates on these exciting developments.

title: PM Modi calls Chile ‘important friend,’ discusses strengthening ties
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasized the strategic role of Chile as a gateway to Antarctica and announced November 4 as National Yoga Day in Santiago. The leaders discussed enhancing cooperation in areas like critical minerals, digital infrastructure, renewable energy, and student exchange, aiming to strengthen bilateral relations and investment opportunities.

title: How Premier League teams can qualify for Champions League, Europe this season
content: a staggering 11 English teams could potentially play in the top three competitions next season . there are a whole host of clauses and considerations that could affect where the places go . will the league get an extra place due to its clubs' performances in Europe this season? what happens to the places reserved for the domestic cups?

title: "Entire Bloc To Vote Against Waqf Bill Tomorrow": MP After INDIA Meet
content: The opposition has unanimously decided to have a full discussion on the Waqf Amendment Bill tomorrow and will vote against it in parliament. The decision came at a meeting this evening, which was attended by all Opposition parties.

title: Video: Donald Trump Claims He "Heard India Will Drop Tariffs Substantially"
content: Little over twenty-four hours before he drops the reciprocal tariff bomb for the world, including his countrymen to deal with, Donald Trump has made a stunning claim - that he heard India will drop tariffs on US imports substantially.

title: Bengaluru Teacher Arrested For Extortion After Affair With Student's Father
content: A Bengaluru teacher has been arrested on charges of blackmail and extorting money from a student's parent with whom she had been having an affair.

title: Karnataka Government Hikes Sales Tax On Diesel
content: Karnataka government has hiked the sales tax on diesel to 21.17 per cent with effect from Tuesday, as a result of which there will be an increase of Rs 2 per litre, bringing the sale price to Rs 91.02.

title: US Court Rejects Claim Of Summons Being Served On Ajit Doval
content: A US court has said that no complaint was delivered to NSA Ajit Doval during his visit to Washington in February, dismissing a claim by Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun that court documents, including a summons, had been served.

title: Trump's Tariffs To Be Effective Immediately After Announcement: White House
content: US President Donald Trump's raft of "Liberation Day" tariffs will take effect immediately after he unveils them on Wednesday, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said.

title: 'Might As Well Split Bangladesh...': Northeast Leaders Slam Dhaka Remark
content: The remarks by Muhammad Yunus, the Bangladesh interim government's chief advisor, on the Northeastern states have drawn sharp reactions in India. Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has described the remarks as "offensive"

title: After SRH Threatens To Move Out Of Hyderabad, Major Development Emerges
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad and Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) have signed a peace treaty agreeing to adhere to the principles laid down by BCCI over tickets and passes sharing.

title: Shimla To Get Asia's Longest Ropeway To Ferry 2,000 People Every Hour
content: Shima is set to construct the world's second-longest ropeway project, spanning 13.79 kilometers, in a bid to boost tourism and alleviate traffic congestion in the popular hill station.

title: Loan Denial, A Spanish Drama And 17 kg Gold Heist: How Gang Looted SBI Bank
content: A loan rejection drove a 30-year-old man to rely on TV shows and YouTube tutorials to carry out a huge robbery at the State Bank of India (SBI) in Karnataka's Davangere last year, police said.

title: Scared After Cement Murder, Man Gets Wife Married To Lover. Then A Big Twist
content: Seeking to avoid being harmed by his wife and her lover after the infamous drum murder in Meerut and the contract killing of a husband in Auraiya, a man from UP had decided to take the high road and get the couple married. There has now been a twist.

title: IPL 2025: Rs 26.75 Crore Shreyas Slams 50, Takes PBKS To Back-To-Back Wins
content: Lucknow Super Giants vs Punjab Kings Highlights, IPL 2025: Shreyas Iyer and Prabhsimran Singh smashed half-centuries as PBKS thrashed LSG by 8 wickets.

title: "To Be Arrested Tomorrrow": Musk After 4 Lakh Social Security Numbers Stolen
content: An individual will be arrested soon for allegedly stealing and selling the personal information of four lakh people from the Social Security database, Elon Musk has said.

title: Ratan Tata's Rs 3,800-Crore Estate: Who Gets What, Key Details Revealed
content: Late industrialist Ratan Tata's estate, estimated to be worth around Rs 3,800 crore, will primarily benefit the Ratan Tata Endowment Foundation and the Ratan Tata Endowment Trust.

title: German Tourist Raped Inside Car In Hyderabad, Accused Arrested: Police
content: A 22-year-old German tourist was allegedly raped by a 24-year-old man inside a car he had taken on rent in Hyderabad on Monday, the police has said.

title: Pay More For Road Journeys, Toll Charges At National Highways Hiked
content: Commuters on national highways and expressways will need to pay more for their road journeys, as the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has increased toll charges by an average of 4 to 5 per cent on highway sections across the country.

title: NBA coaching carousel: What's next for the Grizzlies and Kings jobs?
content: the Memphis Grizzlies fired longtime coach Taylor Jenkins on friday . there are two open head coaching jobs with two weeks to go in the regular season . this year's coaching carousel looks at the pros and cons of each vacancy .

title: On Anna Salai, a sprawling sports ground and a dilapidated palace
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Defenders corral Stallions, RBs start fast
content: the defending champions are 0-1, matching their loss total for all last season . the DC Defenders, despite losing their head coach one week before the opener and coming off a 4-6 season, were the responsible party . other winners on the opening weekend were the Arlington Renegades and Michigan Panthers .

title: Which team takes the top spot after Week 8?
content: no. 1 Texas Longhorns and then-No. 2 Oklahoma Sooners both lost on friday . it's the first time the top two teams in our ESPN.com/USA softball collegiate poll lost on the same day since June 2, 2019 . the top 25 ranking includes our player of the week and game to watch .

title: Our annual mock draft with 32 first-round trades: Deals for Kirk Cousins, Micah Parsons
content: the mock draft of trades is a chance to put together my most ridiculous and enjoyable column of the year . most mocks have no trades, because as hard as it is to predict where players will actually end up, it's downright impossible to project which teams will make moves up and down and impact the draft order . the vast majority of the first 32 picks aren't in the universe in which the no. 2 pick gets traded .

title: Dagger To Chicken's Neck? Why Bangladesh Leader's Remarks Enraged India
content: Bangladesh leader Muhammad Yunus' remarks on the landlocked nature of India's Northeastern states and the sharp response from the region's leaders have again put the vital Chicken's Neck corridor under the spotlight.

title: 'Nokia': Shai Gilgeous-Alexander makes cameo in Drake music video
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander made a cameo in Drake's "Nokia" music video . he appeared at the 2:37 mark in the video with colorways of his new signature Converse sneaker around his neck . the Oklahoma City guard shares the same birthplace as Drake: Ontario, Canada .
